for_sales.sales_text:
24" gaff cuttter, built Bosham, 2004 by Ivan Jefferis. Classic lines, very pretty, fast and manoeuverable. Larch on oak. Teak brightwork, bronze fittings. Straight stem with graceful counter, large cockpit, 2 settee berths with sitting headroom.

Lead bulb-ballasted daggerboard (raised on winch) and drop rudder giving draft from 1.5m to 0.4m. Inboard Beta-Marine 10 diesel engine, depth counter, solar charger. Sails by Batt Sails, spare headsail. 8’ tender.

"Apsara" has been little raced (owners do not race) but was first in class and seventh overall in the Solent Gaffers Rally. This is a reluctant sale of a beautiful boat by owners whose performance does not match that of the boat.

She has been maintained from new by Nick Gates (Emsworth).
Lying Westlands, Chichester Harbour.
Private deep-water mooring may be available.

Detailed 5 page description in Classic Boat October 2004.

URGENT SALE FOR REASONABLE OFFERS TO A GOOD HOME

boat.full_description:
'Apsara' is a 24' gaff cuttter, built Bosham, 2004 by Ivan Jefferis. Classic lines, very pretty, fast and manoeuverable, this computer designed hull has excellent light airs performance. Larch on oak with teak brightwork, copper/bronze fastened and fittings. Straight stem with graceful counter and large cockpit, she has two settee berths with sitting headroom.

Her lead bulb-ballasted daggerboard (raised on winch) and drop rudder give draft from 1.5m to 0.4m. Inboard Beta-Marine 10 diesel engine, depth counter, solar charger. Sails by Batt Sails, spare headsail. 8’ tender.

'Apsara' has been little raced but was first in class and seventh overall in the Solent Gaffers Rally.
boat.name: Apsara
boat.short_description: 'Apsara' was built by Ivan Jefferis at Bosham Hoe in 2004. She is traditionally built of larch on oak.
